messages: ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (18:06): hmm... anne's not here anymore?
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (18:08): &lt 2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de> anyway, boarding time
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (18:09): k, I didn't see the part message
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (18:10): hmm.. Is someone trying to change the WebSocket protocol further away from where it was starting to head?
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (18:10): or, rather proposing a different client-side API?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:13): ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2: no to the secod part. Possiblyt to the first part depending on what you meant
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (18:13): well, what's that thing on the hybi list about a)  sendTextMessage(char []buffer, int offset, int length); // JavaScript 16-bit text send
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (18:14): because the one thing I constantly hear from developers is how easy the client side websocket API is to work with.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:14): ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2: I think that was not about the js-api
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (18:15): I actually have a proposal for the client-side api (which is/should be backwards compatible), if we do get a consensus on the binary sending of data
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:15): It was examples of possible api styles in general
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:15): People seem to be interested in non-js clients
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (18:15): I'm thinking to indicate binary data, you would add on a second argument
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (18:15): there should be one client side api.
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (18:16): no matter what. Because really, why would you need to change it.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:16): ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2: If you build e.g. a python client the api will likely look different
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:17): ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2: Well python code is not necessarily evented
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:17): depending on what you are doing
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (18:17): well, the sending on a websocket isn't evented at all.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:17): To take a more extreme example, a Haskell impl would likely be even more radical
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (18:17): it's actually blocking, iirc.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:17): Receiving is also part of the api
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (18:17): okay, true, functional programming languages would be different, but an object oriented or similar language would not
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:18): Anyway, in the js case, you don't need any parameters to indicate binary or not
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:18): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: (please don't murder me for mentioning Haskell)
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (18:18): yeah, you could use typeof
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:18): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: What? You make no sense
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (18:18): (and similar methods)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:18): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: Well every time I've mentioned Haskell on IRC with you around recently‚Ä¶
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:18): ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2: in the implementation you just have send(data)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:19): and if data is a String you make a text frame and if it is a Blob you make a binary frame
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (18:19): currently a thing we do in node.js, is that in order to send non-utf8 data but by storing it as a string, we do something like:
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:19): s/Blob/BinaryArray/ or whatever
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:19): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: You still make no sense
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (18:19): socket.write("\xff", "binary");
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:19): All I have said is that Haskell has a steep learning curve
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (18:19): if the second argument is blank, I believe it'll actually default to UTF8
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:20): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: Why I would murder you because of that fact is not at all clear
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (18:20): which ever is the default set by socket.setEncoding
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:20): I don't evcen think it is a controversial statement
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (18:22): hey hey
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (18:23): discussion on list is about the wire format (well, apart from the current Shelby Moore entertainment)
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (18:23): the API is unlikely to be affected
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (18:23): what's with that, any way?
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (18:24): the wire format?
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (18:24): it seems like we will get something more complicated
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (18:25): currently I'm really liking the direction of having a length indicator
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (18:25): mostly due to Google
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (18:25): perhaps have two length indicators? The first which is the metadata length, the second which is the message length
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (18:25): if that's part of the issue?
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (18:30): 2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de: what's the issue google has with the protocol?
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (18:33): they want more features in the initial version essentially
2c39bccd623947fa6224ea57d2a727de (18:34): gotta run
ad7340c0d2664b131f969961d78c86b2 (18:34): is there a list of these features?
